title: Rainmaking brings innovation program to Australia
text:
StartupAus creator and Fishburners founding director Peter Bradd is bringing global corporate accelerator Rainmaking to the country, saying big business is still struggling to keep up with the pace of change.

Rainmaking Australia managing director Peter Bradd has spent the last three years running The Beanstalk Factory. Peter Braig

Operating in eight countries, Rainmaking already works with more than 100 Fortune 500 companies and its clients include the likes of Facebook, DHL and LLoyds Bank.

The company runs a 20/20 corporate entrepreneurship program which lets big businesses put a team of people through a 20 week full-time program in which they decide on and build a new product or service for that company.

This will be the first program to be launched by Mr Bradd in Australia, but he also intends to start offering Rainmaking's other services, including a service connecting corporates with compatible start-ups and a venture capital fund, by the end of 20/20.

"The companies I speak to are all struggling to keep up with the pace of change and how they can ensure they're not in an innovation bubble," he said.
description: Peter Bradd was responsible for launching StartupAus and was instrumental in the creation of Fishburners. Now he's bringing Rainmaking to Australia.
